Package seng201.islandtradergame.ui.gui

Class GameWindow

java.lang.Object
seng201.islandtradergame.ui.gui.GameWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener
public class GameWindow
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
This class implements the gameWindow GUI, this is used for the game itself. User interactions with GUI components are used to play the game.
Author:
Kei Carden

  • Constructor Details

    • GameWindow

      public GameWindow​(Island[] isl, Trader trad, int days)
      Creates the game window with a array of islands, a trader and the game length in days.
      Parameters:
      isl - A array of islands
      trad - The trader object
      days - How many days the game will run for

      Returns:
      double The players current balance

    • gameOverCheck

      private void gameOverCheck()
      Checks if one the player can no longer afford to fix there ship, the game has reached the amount of days set or the players balance has reached 0.

      private void gameOver()
      A message is displayed to the user notifying them that the game is over and how much money they made.

    • shoppingHistory

      private void shoppingHistory()
      Creates a two strings containing the items the user has bought and sold This is done by looping through the list of bought or sold items and adding the returned string to a variable this is then displayed on a JTextPanel

    • travelIsland

      private void travelIsland​(int crewWage)
      Updates the game day to the trip length plus the current game day. Changes the island to the island the player selected to travel to. Displays to the player the amount of money spent on wages Updated the trader balance and updates the all other components with gameloop.
      Parameters:
      crewWage - The amount of money spent on crew for the trip

    • repairShipCost

      private int repairShipCost()
      Calculates the cost to repair the ship
      Returns:
      int The cost to repair the ship

    • pirates

      private void pirates​(int crewWage)

    • sail

      private void sail()
      Checks if the ship has no damage and if you have enough money to sail. Each route has a probability of an event occurring the larger this value the higher chance a sea event will happen. If the random number generated from the value is less than two you have made it safe to the island. Otherwise a random event is piked from the three possible sea events. These are bad whether the ship is receives a random amount of damage,

    • islandStats

      private void islandStats​(Island island)
      The islands components in the window are JLabel components. When clicking or hovering the corresponding island object is found. The island stats panel is displayed with the current island stats.
